description: From Middle English slakenen, equivalent to slack +â€Ž -en.

verbs.description: slacken (third-person singular simple present slackens, present participle slackening, simple past and past participle slackened)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To gradually decrease in intensity or tautness; to become slack.
(transitive) To make slack, less taut, or less intense.
To deprive of cohesion by combining chemically with water; to slake.
